intro: [You flop on top of t_c and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/let/lets} out an annoyed squeak.]
[t_c seems to already be trying to squirm {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way out of the nest!]
[t_c is the loudest kitten in the nursery!]
[t_c noses {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} siblings out of the way to nurse.]
[You turn to see a newborn crawling around on {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} own outside the nursery. How on earth did {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} get here?]
[You pick {PRONOUN/t_c/object} up and carry {PRONOUN/t_c/object} back to the nursery.]
[You turn around to have a chat with a Clanmate for five minutes.]
[You need to have a chat with the queens.]
[You walk into the nursery to check on the kittens.]
[r_q smiles and gestures to a newborn tucked into {PRONOUN/r_q/poss} side, gently snoring]
[You politely smile at the queen and leave.]
[You're sat grooming yourself in the clearing.]

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/turn/turns} around and {VERB/t_c/stumble/stumbles} away. You're too surprised to grab {PRONOUN/t_c/object} before {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/crawl/crawls} back to the nursery. Seems at the minimum that {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/have/has} a good sense of direction?]
[t_c walks into your side when wandering around the nursery.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/flop/flops} over and {VERB/t_c/lay/lays} against you, seemingly satisfied with where {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/are/is}.]
[Guess you're not moving any time soon.]
[You notice a newborn kitten... t_c? t_c sits in the corner.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/don't/doesn't} look distressed so you decide to leave {PRONOUN/t_c/object} there.]
[A newborn kitten yells at you from the nursery. You walk over and flick your tail over {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} face.]
[t_c seems to cuddle closer to you, purring.]
[t_c reaches {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tiny little paw up, placing it on your nose with what you could swear is an itty bitty smile.]
[t_c reaches up and tries to touch your nose.]
[t_c mews even louder than the rest of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} litter, as if it were a competition.]
[t_c is making a sound that sounds vaguely like giggling.]
[Did ... Did t_c just try to bat you away?]
[t_c must be the quietest kit you've ever met!]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/shift/shifts} in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} sleep, chest rising and falling slowly.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/kick/kicks} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} legs in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} sleep in a running motion.]

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/rest/rests} against {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} siblings and {VERB/t_c/purr/purrs}. It seems {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'ve/'s} already made an unbreakable promise of protection- far earlier then what you would have expected!]

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/lay/lays} still and quiet. You press your nose to {PRONOUN/t_c/object} in fear to make sure {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} okay, seems {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} just a quiet one...]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/squirm/squirms} up to you and {VERB/t_c/place/places} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paws on your nose, holding you as close as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can.]
[Never did you think a kitten could say meow' so bluntly, but here you are.]

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/puff/puffs} out {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little chest as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/peep/peeps} in protest of staying still in the nest- it seems {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/want/wants} to explore before {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can even see!]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/shake/shakes} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head at you disapprovingly. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/have/has} so much to learn...]
[You watch curiously as t_c opens {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little mouth again and again making a small popping sound. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} so cute!!!]
[t_c boops your nose as you roll into {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]

[You climb on top of t_c's back and begin to purr as {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tiny body settles. The two of you seem comfortable despite the distant yowling of your parents in worry. y_p attempts to separate the two of you.]
[To {PRONOUN/y_p/poss} disdain, in a few moments you both are in the same spot, but this time t_c sleeps on your back.]
[y_p carefully places a moss blanket over you and your littermates. You smile softly as you curl up under the warm coverage. t_c nudges your paw and settles beside you.]
[Together like this, you're safe. Nothing outside the nursery matters. Not here and now, not while you and t_c are together.]
[t_c cheekily giggles as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/roll/rolls} around the nest. You and y_l purr in tiny laughter as you squint, watching {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little form.]
[You flinch back as t_c yowls in your little ear.]

[You and t_c snuggle together in a pile of feathers that r_q gave y_p as a present. You both smile as you knead the soft texture. t_c seems like {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} especially enjoying it!]
[You curl against y_p and shiver slightly as a cool breeze enters the nursery. Despite {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} small size, t_c takes notice.]
[y_p stares in shock at the little kitten who spoke so clearly only to see tiny t_c pointing at you with {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little paws. y_p immediately pulls you both closer and purrs loudly.]
[You spot t_c crawling around in circles, before suddenly biting r_c's leg.]
[t_c mewls in response to you saying {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} name.]
[It appears as if {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} already trying to puff out the fur of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} chest.]
[t_c wobbles {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little paws out in front of {PRONOUN/t_c/self}, mewling loudly.]
[Fresh to the world, it seems like {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} already trying to find steady ground to explore.]
[As you turn to comfort t_c, you spot a few kits trying to sneak out of the nursery!]
[t_c mewls angrily as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} shoved out of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest.]
[t_c is hard at work, kneading {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest with itty-bitty paws.]
[t_c buries {PRONOUN/t_c/self} deep into the fluff of t_p's tail.]
[t_c is buried under a pile of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} siblings!]
[You can barely make out t_c, they're so deeply buried in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} parent's nest.]
[t_c snuggles deep into your belly fur.]
[You wrap your tail around {PRONOUN/t_c/object}, shielding {PRONOUN/t_c/object} from the cold.]
[t_c squirms at your side, mewling frantically.]
[You lick the top of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head, quieting {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} cries.]
[t_c presses against your side, sound asleep.]
[You breathe in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} milky scent, swearing to love {PRONOUN/t_c/object} forever.]
[You run your beautiful new kit's perfect name over and over through your mind, certain you'll never ever forget it.]
[t_c reaches up and bats at you. {PRONOUN/t_c/poss/CAP} tiny claws prick your nose.]
[t_c has managed to wiggle {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way out of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest and is trying to make {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way out of the nursery.]
[t_c is already trying to crawl out of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest!]
[What's this newborn doing outside of the nursery?]
[You pick up the kit and return {PRONOUN/t_c/object} to r_q. t_c is gonna be a troublemaker, you can already tell.]
[t_c looks up at you, seeming confused and almost wary.]
[...did {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} just make a face of disgust?]
[You want to feel offended, but it's kind of hilarious to see that expression on a newborn's face.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} pretty proud of {PRONOUN/t_c/self} when {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/disturb/disturbs} one of the other kits. What a little nuisance!]
[t_c is shoving all the other kits out of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way. How can a newborn be this unstoppable?!]
[t_c is squirming and shoving poor t_l around.]
[...It looks like t_l has just accepted {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} fate.]
[You watch curiously as t_c opens {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little mouth again and again making a small popping sound. {PRONOUN/t_c/poss/CAP}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} so cute!!!]
[You're trying to find your way to a queen to feed you when... SMACK!]
[t_c has shoved you out of the way!]
[You snuggle up next to t_c, falling into a peaceful slumber.]
[You mew at t_c, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/turn/turns} to stare at you.]
[You mew at t_c, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/turn/turns} to stare at you, before squeaking back a reply.]
[This turns into a meow war, that ends with you winning by mewling far louder than t_c- and promptly getting shushed by the queens.]
[You step on t_c's tail, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/bite/bites} you in return. The two of you get into a fight, and have to be separated.]
[You start crying, but t_c snuggles next to you, and the comforting warmth makes you calm down.]
[You two sleep for the day, not making a peep.]
[t_c boops your nose as you roll into {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]

[You climb on top of t_c's back and begin to purr as {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tiny body settles. The two of you seem comfortable despite the distant yowling of your parents in worry. y_p attempts to separate the two of you.]

[You flinch back as t_c yowls in your little ear.]

[You curl against y_p and shiver slightly as a cool breeze enters the nursery. Despite {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} small size, t_c takes notice.]

[t_c seems to let out a very polite mew towards you, wiggling towards you in order to lean against you.]
[Seems the kitten only started purring when you drew near.]
[You're not having a good day, sighing as you lay down on a rock close to the nursery.]
[You feel the small t_c plop down on your tail. You have no idea how {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} got here.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} seems drawn to you though, and keeps snuggling you... and you start to feel better.]
[t_c has somehow managed to shift all of the moss in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest to one side and is now lying in the center of a small mossy fort.]
[t_c has somehow managed to shift all of the moss in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest to one side and is now lying in the center of a small mossy fort.]
[t_c mewls angrily as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} shoved out of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest.]
[t_c is hard at work, kneading {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest with itty-bitty paws.]
[r_q picks up t_c and pulls {PRONOUN/t_c/object} away as you approach.]
[t_p has {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} whole body wrapped around t_c, shielding {PRONOUN/t_c/object} from you.]
[r_c quickly grabs t_c and carries {PRONOUN/t_c/object} away as {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} {VERB/t_c/stumble/stumbles} curiously towards you.]
[Could even this newborn kit be judging you?]
[From across camp, you stare at one of the only members of c_nClan who doesn't know what you did.]
[r_q sees you staring and steps in front of t_c to block your view.]
[You sigh. It won't be long before someone lets {PRONOUN/t_c/object} know.]
[t_c limply bats at the stars glimmering around {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]
[t_c purrs softly as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/bask/basks} in the starlit grass.]
[You find yourself wandering close to the Dark Forest border when you spot movement out of the corner of your eye.]
[You turn your head to see... is that- is that t_c?!]

[With a jolt you realize that t_c is stumbling right towards the border. You lunge forward and grab the kit, ignoring {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} mewls of protest as you carry {PRONOUN/t_c/object} back towards StarClan's hunting grounds.]
[t_c has somehow managed to climb onto a large rock.]
[t_c yowls as you come near, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little voice shaking.]
[Oh, it's t_c. Should {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} be over here? {PRONOUN/t_c/poss/CAP} family is probably looking for {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]
[t_c is whining for comfort again. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} should know better by now that it's not coming.]
[You see t_c rolling in the misty fields, the tiny kitten angrily flopping around.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/squeal/squeals}, stomping {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little paws onto the ground.]
[Is.. is this what a tantrum from {PRONOUN/t_c/object} looks like?]
[t_c is rolling around in the grass.]
Oh, y_c... It's torture to see you everywhere.
[t_c is stomping {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little paws on the ground, figuring out how to use them.]
